emphasis.guibutton: Polycom IP-550 Phone Quick Start Guide

listitem.para: Internal Extension
Dial the extension number
External Number
Dial the 10 digits of the local or long distance number.
Dial the country code + numbers for international calls.
Pick up the handset or press the Speaker button.
Press hold button to put active call on hold. Active line will begin flashing. You can now answer an incoming call on another line, or select another line to make a new call.
To resume a call, press the line button associated with that call.
(Note: If a second call is in progress, that call will be placed on hold while the original call is resumed).
While a call is active, press the Mute button. To cancel, press the Mute button again.
Press the Redial button on phone to redial the last number.
Use the handset navigation arrow buttons on the right to select the number to redial and then press the button underneath the "Dial" label on the display.
Attended Transfer (you talk to who it is being transferred to)
To initiate an attended transfer, press the Transfer button during an active call.
The active call is placed on hold and you hear a dial tone.
Dial the new number. Once the call is answered you can have a conversation before completing the transfer.
To complete the transfer now, just hangup.
(Note: If you hang up during the second call before it begins ringing, the transfer will not be completed. The second call is ended while the first party is still on hold).
To cancel the transfer, press the Cancel button (with an X in the circle)
Unattended (blind) Transfer
To initiate a blind transfer, press the Transfer button during an active call.
The active call is placed on hold and you hear a dial tone.
Dial the new number and once it begins to ring, just hang up.
To cancel the transfer, press the Cancel button (with an X in the circle)

When no active call on the line
Dial the first party's number.
After the party answers the phone, press Conference button on your phone (Party 1 is placed on-hold).
Enter the second party's number and let it ring.
After the second party answers the phone, press the Conference button again to conference them.
All parties are conferenced on the same call.
Note: Press the Conference button again to add another call to your conference up to the number of lines you have on your phone.
When a call is on hold and the other line is either ringing or connected.

If the phone has only one call on hold, press the button under the label More on your display and then press the button under Join on the following display screen to join the call on hold with the active call.

If the phone has more than one call on hold, the Conference button places the active call on hold and prompts the user to select the other line key to join with the conference call (or make an outbound call). Pressing the Conference button again will join the two calls).

All parties are conferenced on the same call. A special brief tone will be played to all three parties to indicate that a conference call is in progress. (You may only join two lines using the conference button)

section.para: You can drop one of the callers using the button below the label Split on your display and then choosing the line to drop, then pressing the button just below End Call on your display to drop the call you donâ€™t want. Press the line key for the remaining caller to talk with them again.
The initiator of the conference call can terminate the conference call any time by hanging up.

listitem.para: To pick up a call that is currently on-hold at another extension:
Dial #9+extension of the caller who has placed the other caller on-hold. You are then connected to the on-hold caller.

para.emphasis: Caller2â€™s extension is 1234 in this example
Caller2 tells Caller3 they have a call on hold for them
Caller3 dials #91234 to pick up Caller1 from Caller2â€™s phone and the call drops from Caller2â€™s phone.

listitem.para: To pick up a call that is ringing at another extension:
Dial #9+extension of the caller whose phone is ringing.

para.emphasis: Caller3 dials #91234 while it is ringing to pick up the call and talk to Caller1

listitem.para: To forward your phone to another phone from your own extension:
Dial #33.
Enter your passcode and press #.
Enter the number you want to forward your phone to and press #.

para.emphasis: Note: This can be another extension or an external phone number.

listitem.para: All calls to your extension will be forwarded to the new number until you cancel the forward (see Cancel Forward).
To forward your phone to another phone from any other extension:
Dial #33.
Press *.
Enter your extension and press #.
Enter your passcode and press #.
Enter the number you want to forward your phone to and press #.

para.emphasis: Note: This can be another extension or an external phone number.

listitem.para: All calls to your extension will be forwarded to the new number until you cancel the forward (see Cancel Forward).
To forward your phone to another phone from an external number:
Dial the company phone number.
Press #33.
Enter your extension and press #.
Enter your passcode and press #.
Enter the number you want to forward your phone to and press #.

para.emphasis: Note: This can be another extension or an external phone number.

listitem.para: All calls to your extension will be forwarded to the new number until you cancel the forward (see Cancel Forward).

section.para: Transfer Call (extension is Forwarded to an external number)

listitem.para: Unattended (blind) Transfer call directly to voicemail:
while the call is active, dial *1+extension+#
Unattended (blind) Transfer to a specific destination:
To transfer the call to another extension
while the call is active, dial *2+extension+#
To transfer the call to an external number
while the call is active, dial *2+phone number+#
Dial #34
Enter your mailbox number when prompted.

section.para: To broadcast a message to all phones (except those on Do Not Disturb):

listitem.para: Dial 799.
Speak your message.
Hang up.
Press the Do Not Disturb button
